website_summaries.verdict: A low-cost motion sensor/alarm with some known defects, including false alarms.
pros: Accurate detection even if an intruder is out of "sight lines
cons: Occasional false alarms caused by movements in nature

customer_reviews.title: I used it as a mail chime and it's awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! My house has a long driveway and I cannot see the mailbox from any window. I was considering to get the mail chime but it is a bit expensive in terms of price so I thought I will give motion detector a try as it's cheaper. I had trouble using duct tape or Velcro tape because my mailbox is plastic and it just falls off. My husband used a nail to secure on the mailbox door and it worked like a charm! Just heard its chime 30 minutes ago then I went out and got my mail, it was amazing! No more walking out every hour to see if my mail is here.
customer_reviews.author: Rach

customer_reviews.title: Beat delivery person to door
customer_reviews.text: I installed this Driveway Alarm so I would know when someone came up to the house. This is a very helpful system to have at a reasonable price. I don't miss package deliveries, I am at the door before the delivery person gets there.
customer_reviews.author: Athanickels

customer_reviews.title: Worse than useless
customer_reviews.text: From whom are all these glowing reviews coming? I am no longer going to trust Amazon reviews. This unit is absolutely rubbish. The motion sensor eats alkaline batteries within a 48-hours, persists in giving false alarms when there is absolutely nothing moving does, not hold the link with the base unit, has no sensitivity adjustment ..although black electrical tape works pretty well and no on or off switch either. I have been messing with it for a month now. I've had my tech weenie friends over to try and get it to work to no avail. It's going in the trash
customer_reviews.author: M. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for a while, but then.....
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this alarm works surprisingly well. My only difficulty was in getting the battery compartments open! When I finally managed it, I dispensed with the ridiculously small screws with impossibly shallow slots and secured the covers with tape. The range of the sensor is a bit narrow, but it works well on the door casing of my garage. Six months later: The sensing unit failed, and when I attempted to set up the other one the unnecessary screws for the battery compartment seemed welded in place. Destroying the case appeared to be my only option for opening it. I'll buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: My safety is the best ever with a onetime fee
customer_reviews.text: The apartment homeowner association do not allow doorbells here.Since buying this product I can now open up doors & windows for fresh air. My safety is the best ever with a onetime fee. Best of all the price of all is this summer my electric bill will go down related to the high cost of central air. I can now enjoy fresh air. Believe me this Alarm Rings very LOUD YOU WILL WAKE UP. NOW I CAN SLEEP WITH PEACE>INCREASE THE PEACE. GAYLE
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: I have a long driveway and this gives me a heads up if someone is driving or walking to my house. A few false signals due to leaves in the wind and the random duck but all in all pretty awesome.
customer_reviews.author: jp machine

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works very well , purchased for my elderly mom and set up at the end of her driveway about 300' away. Line of sight is direct from sensor to receiver and I'm sure that helps. Sensitive enough to pick up crows/birds feeding nearby so false or inaccurate alarms occasionally sound. I purchased this second unit for my work place gatehouse as a gift. Guards seem happy not to have to swivel their heads all day looking for arriving or exiting cars.
customer_reviews.author: J. Coyne

customer_reviews.title: Easy to configure but with limitations
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to install and use. There are a number of features that would have made this perfect. (1) There is only one choice of sound on low. I am monitoring 3 directions so I have now way to know which way a visitor is approaching. I would have liked the ability to choose a different sound for each directions. (2) the detectors do not work (or work well) when sun shines directly at the sensor screen and I keep getting false alerts. This would work better if it had a small protection against sun (think of tennis hat) for the lens. Lastly, this is not about security in my mind. This is more about awareness.
customer_reviews.author: M. Shahsavar

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent. Unreliable.  :(  I wanted so much to like this because I need it so much.
customer_reviews.text: Inconsistent. Unreliable. :( I wanted so much to like this because I need it so much. One sensor shows the blue light on occasion to show there is power, but it has never worked as a sensor. The other sensor either goes off relentlessly chiming (more than the usual four chimes) or doesn't sense any movement or heat at all. It will remain silent for several hours at the minimum and this today it chimed for the first time since Wednesday afternoon even though it's the only door we use regularly multiple times a day.
customer_reviews.author: BestDayofMyLife

customer_reviews.title: Very affordable
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this purchase! We have a long driveway and we have a monitor down at the beginning of our driveway & the alarm in our kitchen window so we are notified when someone pulls in. I recommend not placing the monitor in front of any trees, bushes or tall grass that will set off the alarm when the wind blows. It is very easy to install and the weather has not bothered ours after 2 years of being outside and the batteries have not had to be changed. It is definitely worth the money and will purchase again if anything ever happens to the one I have now.
customer_reviews.author: Woody9311

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive driveway alarm...lasted 9 days:(
customer_reviews.text: 9/29/18 Update Yesterday, i noticed the primary driveway unit quit communicating. Why? I have no idea... i attempted to resync the unit and nothing. Batteries were brand new and less than 2 weeks old, so thats not the issue... I would appreciate if Byone would contact me with a solution. I'll add to this review later. Ive dropped my review to 2 stars... Original Review after receipt: Have used these in the past and they always have worked well. This is the first time i've purchased a dual unit. It works well, but it would be better if the unit separated the two by an audible tone and/or Zone light on the receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Pmag63

customer_reviews.title: One and a half years and still working
customer_reviews.text: Although it comes with two sensors, I am only using one and it is installed on my covered front porch. Reason being is you can't distinguish between the two sensors the one being triggered. So far it is still working (had a different brand that only lasted 3 months) after 2 summers and 2 winters outdoors in Dallas, TX. I believe I've changed the batteries twice since I got it. My front porch is always busy at it is where we enter and exit our home and I almost have daily package deliveries. It has served its purpose letting us know if somebody is at our front porch and would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Dad of Four

customer_reviews.title: Too many false alarms outdoors
customer_reviews.text: I liked the different chime sounds that can be used, but not much else. According to instructions it can't be placed in direct sunlight, so I couldn't put near my door entry ways. It goes off at the least provocation and from that standpoint can't be used reliably outdoors. Indoors you might have better luck controlling what the sensor is facing. So if I wanted to put a sensor in my detached shop to detect someone who has already entered the building, it would work OK. Would not recommend for outdoor usage especially where you have bushes, trees, shade and sun movements that will constantly trigger this sensor. No way to adjust sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: TechConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Work just as described
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly as it says. Extremely simple and useful. Great range even through walls. I only wish the volume could be more finely adjusted. For my taste, even the quietest setting is way too loud for everyday use. Easily solved by inserting inside of a favorite stuffed toy. Now the dragon's eyes light up when someone is near. Who needs Sting?
customer_reviews.author: Dan or Adrienne

customer_reviews.title: 1byone wireless security
customer_reviews.text: Decent product for the price but randomly keeps forgetting the paired sensors so have to re-pair one or sometimes both of them with the receiver once every 2 weeks or so. Also the manual is rather lacking and still can't figure out how to make it chime more then once or whether I can make each sensor have different chime or not, thus taking a star off for reliability and not included optional!? power adapter, and another star for poor documentation of not easy to set-up product.
customer_reviews.author: JoeBlow

customer_reviews.title: Unpredictable and not helpful at all
customer_reviews.text: the "beam" is too wide and makes it hard to catch just my driveway traffic without dinging every time somebody drives down the road. The one I put under my shelter to make sure nobody was sneaking in my yard to fiddle with my mower just goes off for no reason. And I was sure to put it high enough so that my backyard chickens didn't set it off. I bought this product and also a plug in doorbell from the same company and was not happy with the performance or quality of either. Try another brand and spend a little more money. Because this one was a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Bad Girl

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome! Sensitive.
customer_reviews.text: So, I bought these for a non traditional use. I use them to protect my chickens. I set them up outside the coup when I saw coyotes bothering them. Not only do the alert me to big animals, they ring for rats or whatever approaching the cage. Still working months later, rain or shine. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Lacalema

customer_reviews.title: It didn't last very long
customer_reviews.text: It worked okay for about 9 months, with only an occasional false alarm. Now, the receiver unit continuously sounds an alarm. It continues to do this, even when I remove the batteries from the sensor/transmitter units, so there is no signal coming to the receiver unit. The receiver also continues to sound an alarm when it is powered by fresh batteries (1.60 volts each) or is being powered from 110 volts AC power using their DC voltage adapter. I recall reading some negative reviews when I bought this equipment, but I thought I'd take my chances with it.
customer_reviews.author: Laina

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing customer service! I originally had trouble pairing my device and discovered one of my sensors was defective. The company was responsive and rectified the issue. The unit works better than I had anticipated. The alarm is very clear and I like having the options of loud, soft, and chime. I like that sensors can be added. I am also impressed with how far away I can have the sensors and they can still be picked up my the device. I recommend this product for both its quality and it's customer service; very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: siva aiken

customer_reviews.title: Good to upgrade your camera system to alert you to motion
customer_reviews.text: Love these things got high definition cameras don't want to stare at the monitor all day so it alerts me to when I can look to see what's going on when there's activity they let me know when there's motion and the area of the camera covers it's a great way to upgrade your camera system to let you know when to watch and where to watch I bought several of them and label them Zone a b c and d one for each camera and you can sit them on different signals so that way you know what area is detected motion
customer_reviews.author: jeffwestbrook

customer_reviews.title: 1byone Wireless Home Security Driveway Alarm stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this was great, but after two months it stopped working. I thought maybe the batteries were dead so I bought a 6V DC adapter and it still does not work. Small blue light comes on when someone passes by the sensor but no chime/alarm on receiver. Lights and chime work when pairing devices but no chime/alarm when someone passes the sensors.
customer_reviews.author: debzdezigns

customer_reviews.title: Not very reliable, dry rots
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about the first year and then some but the motions would be detected by animals and cause false alarm triggers. Also, the bases that detect motion, the screens dry rotted over time and I had to throw it away. They essentially busted open like tissue paper. Again good product if you dont have animals that will trigger the alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Millhone

customer_reviews.title: This unit is awesome for my application
customer_reviews.text: This unit is awesome for my application. I have a son with autism that sometimes wanders at night. I set this in the hallway when we go to bed with the base unit near our bed. It gives a chime when he gets up so we can make sure he is safe. We also take it to hotels and our summer cabin. Could also work for someone with Alzheimer's or something similar.
customer_reviews.author: Idaho mom

customer_reviews.title: Not good on breezy days.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this alarm @ the end of my drive, on the back side of my mail box post. No trees, shrubs or any objects, other than AIR around the sensor. It will constantly alarm on a windy day, so much I turn it off. I have read all instructions 10 times over & can't figure what I've done wrong. Nothing. It's puzzling to me that the alarm does NOT go off during hard rain or sleet or snow flurries. But you let a breeze blow by & you'd swear you had every friend you'd ever known showing up @ your door!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has never worked for me - super frustrated - really would enjoy this for protecting my home.
customer_reviews.text: I am a tech savvy person and I have used other motion detectors in the past with success. Getting this one to work is insufferable. I read the poorly written manual many times, read amazon reviews and even searched for videos to explain how this would work all to no avail. SPARE YOURSELF YOUR SANITY AND BUY A DIFFERENT MODEL.
customer_reviews.author: Black Walnut

customer_reviews.title: ONE of the most important forms of protection
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! We live in the sticks. While hubby was working on The Slope, someone ended up coming up to the house about 3AM. He was gone before the Troopers got here. If I had this then, I'd had been way more prepared before someone could have gotten to my door. We just bought another set. This set is to alert to intruders, the new set will be to alert us to bears (we see the prints, but have never seen them walking through) and with baby moose being born, well, you just can't see them enough, and this will let us know they're in our yard, and we won't miss them!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Wright

customer_reviews.title: Even though I saw several bad reviews, I thought I would give it a ...
customer_reviews.text: Neither motion detector would pair with the receiver. It would sound one time as if it paired, but nothing more. Even though I saw several bad reviews, I thought I would give it a try!! My mistake and I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Moe

customer_reviews.title: I've had these for a few days now. I ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a few days now. I installed one in my garage, which leads into my house, and the 2nd one under my deck, which is another vulnerable point because there are bedroom windows underneath it. So far, no false alarms, and it picked me up flawlessly while i was trudging through the dark. They hadn't gone off until this morning, something triggered it several times.I went out onto my deck and shined a spot light, and then i heard some rustling in the bushes. So, there was some sort of critter setting it off, so at least it works.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: The sensors seem to be good with a detection range of up to around 35 ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything works well. The sensors seem to be good with a detection range of up to around 35 feet and even much more for large objects like trucks. Few false alarms from wind, etc. The receiver unit picks up well with settings for loud, soft, and quiet with a flashing light. The chime rings four times and is so loud it can be annoying but it will catch your attention. Recommend also purchasing the AC adapter cord, since it is less expensive than the required C batteries in the receiver. All in all, a good value.
customer_reviews.author: rustyoldchevelle

customer_reviews.title: Warning System
customer_reviews.text: Shipped fast. Everything is as expected. I'm happy. I'm building a cabin on 3 acres and am using it to warn people if they come onto my land. I have it hooked up to a shed.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse L.

customer_reviews.title: It’s a lemon!
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great for... 41 days. Just long enough to get past the return window. Lights and beeps indicate that both the sensor and receiver are on (the sensor has fully charged batteries... I checked, the receiver is plugged in). The receiver does not receive when the sensor is tripped. I tried (by the book) to re-cinq the units, to no avail. The company’s website says it costs $6. I’d be less peaved if it hadn’t cost three times as much here.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Saint Pe'

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Almost too great... read notes. Now used as a security option.
customer_reviews.text: I used it when my neighbor returned from work. I needed to get her dog back when she returned. It worked so well, I would wait a bit so she didn't get suspicious of how fast I got her dog back. The dog even knew she got to go home when it chimed. She gave me the dog so now I use it as a deterrent to thieves because the light blinks on the outside box, with motion, and I have a sign that states you are on camera, also bought from Amazon, I think. I leave the inside alarm off.
customer_reviews.author: Jillbert

customer_reviews.title: I use my alarms when traveling. I place one ...
customer_reviews.text: I use my alarms when traveling. I place one sensor in my car and the other towards my room door. I always insist on 1st floor room (fires) facing park lot, park car close to room window then place alarms receiver on window ledge. A car break in will alert me and i will be shining my flashlight on thief while calling 911. Use it to stop teens from sneaking out.
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Updating this because 1Byone helped me resolve issues I had. One of my sensors was not functioning well. Decent for the price. Correct positioning is a must. I turn this off on windy days or it will go off non-stop. Does alert me when someone is approaching my house, which is what I wanted it for. Now I know when UPS has dropped off a package, or someone comes to my house when not expecting. I think this is best for garage/indoor applications. If I was using it indoors, I'm sure I'd give it 5 stars. Be aware - no batteries (you'll need 3 AAA for each sensor and 3 C batteries for the reciever) and NO AC adapter included.
customer_reviews.author: Frazzle

customer_reviews.title: Very easy. I have a long drive way and like ...
customer_reviews.text: These arrived the day after I ordered them! I put the batteries in and they synced up immediately. Mostly needed the directions (included) to help decide which chime, alarm, or flashing light combo I wanted. Very easy. I have a long drive way and like to be alerted to incoming visitors. The chime options worked well for us. Hopefully they will last longer than my old ones that fritz out after a few months due to the wet weather. The bonus is that there are two sensors, so when the one does fritz out eventually, I have a back up.
customer_reviews.author: L. D.

customer_reviews.title: This was a replacement for the one that broke & ..lasted over two years.
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for the one that broke & it worked for a long time. This new model which has more switches than the old one---the new one also keeps going off even when nothing is in front of the sensors...Bummer. Especially at night !! @#$%>>>PRODUCT Up-Date.. 8/27/2016....The item was not functioning properly..Thanks to the seller a refund & replacement was provided. The emails back and forth with the seller were prompt commendable. The new wireless device a different model -- works just fine and my Koi pond was saved from the nightly Raccoons attack.. I would buy again and recommend this seller to my friends....JITNEY
customer_reviews.author: Jitney

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: Works Only Intermittently - Refunding
customer_reviews.text: Returning for a refund. Only works intermittently. Pairing the sensors and receiver worked successfully but when someone passes in front of the sensors, it will only chime sometimes. You can stand there and wave your hand right in front of it and nothing. Stand there and keep waving and maybe 15 seconds later, it MIGHT chime, it might not. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: M.F. Luder

customer_reviews.title: Great feeling more secure
customer_reviews.text: I set these up along my driveway & the entry zone to my backyard & my chicken pen. They work beautifully. It took me an hour to synchronize them but after watching 2 YouTube videos & rereading the instructions for the 20th time, I got them both synched together at the same time, finally. Squirrels have set them off, but since I have it set on the low chime it doesn't bother me & shows me they are working, even after a big rain storm. Peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: PolarPro

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my yard so I could tell when my packages were being dropped off and they are awesome. I couldn't believe how sensitive they were. Literally, butterflies were setting it off. If you use loud settings it will be loud enough for anyone to hear. I am very glad I purchased these as they give me another level of security as well as just being more aware of things outside. I would buy these again. Also, I've had one of the sensors outside and through rain, wind and a lot of sun, they've held up very well.
customer_reviews.author: kratomlife

customer_reviews.title: confused
customer_reviews.text: I can't get it to sync to both units. When I turn on the receiver one sensor unit works but only one time, after I trigger the sensor I have to turn the receiver off and back on. I can't get it to do anything the instructions say. The lights on the receiver stay on all the time, I can only get one kind of alarm. Overall I don't understand this thing. I catch on pretty quick to things so I am confused. Maybe I got a lemon. I'm sure if it worked correctly it would probably be worth the money but right now, mine isn't.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: One in every 3 or 4 work...
customer_reviews.text: When these alarms work, they work great, year after year. The problem is they don't always work out of the box and must be returned for a working one. I just ordered one which came on Saturday, opened it up and set things up with batteries and turning it on and choosing the alarm type. The motion sensors lite up when you passed by but no alarm... Ordered a second set that afternoon (Saturday) and it came in Mondays mail. Opened them up, added batteries and this time one sensor sounded the alarm and the other just lite up. So I just ordered a third, hopefully this set will work.
customer_reviews.author: Janet M. Colbert

customer_reviews.title: Great sensors!
customer_reviews.text: Great sensors! In the beginning it was a little annoying trying to connect the two sensors with the main speaker. Since the noise is not very pleasant during setup but that's what there made for. Also I thought I purchased the one with the plug in wall charger but realized I chose the wrong one in the end. (make sure you choose the one you want or you'll have to go out and buy C batteries) lol and AAA batteries for the two sensors. I ended up finding a USB cord with the same adapter which worked out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: T.K

customer_reviews.title: only bad thing is when you lose power you have to ...
customer_reviews.text: Have 2 Receivers and 5 Transmitters, only bad thing is when you lose power you have to set them up again, these are not the battery operated ones these are the plug in to AC, have two in garage, one by front door and one at the back door.... The battery's in the transmitter seem to hold up pretty good , have not replaced any as of yet, dogs set off the back door maybe 60 times a day... Anyway I do like them....
customer_reviews.author: me4ku

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly as described. Originally first receiver worked intermitently ...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly as described. Originally first receiver worked intermitently. I was contacted by product/seller and notified them of my problem. They instantly sent me a free replacement that has been working since then. I'm using each motion sensor for the front door/patio and back area of my condo. Anytime someone comes close to my patio or doors it chimes and lets me know someone is approaching before they even ring the door bell or knock on the door.
customer_reviews.author: S. Truong

customer_reviews.title: Works, Big League
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it is supposed to do....only louder. I mean really loud. I put one sensor at the front door and one at the back so that I would know when the dog was ready to come back in. Took me about ten seconds to realize that the sound of this alarm was going to give me a heart attack and the dog would be stuck outside forever. I actually had to wrap the base in a towel and stuff it into a kitchen cabinet in order to make the alarm bearable. Of course it is called an "alarm" for a reason, so there are worse problems to have.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: This alarm solved our problem. We get a lot of packages delivered here. Often we don't know they have come. I put one sensor halfway down the drive, about fifty feet separation, and the other by the door. The alarm is in another room, but can be heard thru the wall okay. Feel more secure as well. One problem was with initial set up. The letters on the switches are very hard to read. I was unable to get the alarm to recognize the sensors. With the magnifying glass I found I had the off and on confused, after which it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bissett

customer_reviews.title: These work great. They have a pretty wide "eye" so you ...
customer_reviews.text: These work great. They have a pretty wide "eye" so you don't have to have it facing exactly in the right direction which gives you some leeway in placement. The chime is not too annoying and you can have two settings. We use it in an indoor setting for customers walking in and it works good for that too. The chime is a little long - longer than a doorbell - but serves it's purpose. I thought the price was reasonable for one receiver and two alarms.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila B.

customer_reviews.title: USE in PLASTIC mailbox.
customer_reviews.text: I put one at the door and I get an alert whenever someone comes on the porch. Of course, bunnies and an occasional bird set it off. One issue I had was it not working when I put it in my metal mailbox. The metal must block it, even though it’s not that far from the receiver. My neighbor has one in his plastic mailbox and always knows when his mail is delivered. It’s great for that purpose, if your mailbox is plastic.
customer_reviews.author: sbee

customer_reviews.title: Great item for home security
customer_reviews.text: We have used these for years and they are great! Wireless lets us mount these all over a farm generally less than 70 feet. Second we live in a city so both lost people wander through and a coyote will wander through. This item chimes when both come through. The con is wind moving things and rain often makes it chime as well. People have these inside garages for intruders and it chimes in a house.
customer_reviews.author: Marc W

customer_reviews.title: Great for hallway alarms too
customer_reviews.text: We have used this as an alarm in my hallway so I can hear my kid coming out of bed. This product is very loud (I’m hard of hearing) and I can actually hear it go off. My only complaint is I wish I could change how long the alarm beeps for. It will chime 4xs when movement is detected. So by the time my son gets to the second sensor, it won’t pick him up because the first sensor is still beeping. That’s how I measured how far out of his room he is. Overall, I would absolutely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Inglish Short

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I installed the 1byone wireless home security driveway alarm a few weeks ago after my truck was vandalized. Now I will be able to hear if anyone gets near my truck. Including squirrels, birds and the neighbors cat. I didn't realize my yard was the gateway to wildlife. With that said, I could not ask for a better wireless alarm. Works exactly as described.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R

customer_reviews.title: Did not work as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Tried 3 different transmitters on a driveway that has over 35 feet of OPEN space. All 3 transmitters produced false readings and a LOT of them. I watched the transmitters as they were giving the false alarms and there was nothing I could see that would cause this! The original Amazon package was damaged pretty bad, but the items themselves had no visible damage. This product is not usable as described and I have sent it back to Amazon for refund
customer_reviews.author: RKH

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have a long drive way that swings around behind my house so I can never knew when someone drives up. I put one of the sensor on a tree 2/4 of the way up and now I know when someone comes up the driveway. I also put one on the front porch stairs so when delivery people come and leave something without ringing the bell, I'll know. My only complaints so far. Directions were a little hard to follow. I would have preferred if each sensor had a different sound so I could tell which one was activated. Very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Kehoe

customer_reviews.title: Our cats have pretty regular places to be so we put the sensors ...
customer_reviews.text: Not just a visitor alarm, cat alarm also. Our driveway is not long but we spend most of our evenings towards the back of the house. Our cats have pretty regular places to be so we put the sensors in those places. One sensor is not far from the street, just turn it away from the street and avoid cars setting it off. It's nice to know when the cats are the back door wanting in. This works pretty darn good. Have not had to change any batteries yet but have only had for ~ 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought one last year this one was for a gift. I bought the adapter for my first one but haven’t used yet because the sensors and monitor are still working on the original batteries. It works very well picks up everything. Monitor beep is easy to hear on low and loud you can hear from very far away lol The only con -make sure sensor is not in direct sunlight
customer_reviews.author: Adel A England

customer_reviews.title: Bought it year 2017 and still working!

product_meta.title: 1byone Wireless Home Security Driveway Alarm, 1 Battery-operated Receiver and 2 PIR Motion Sensor Detector Weatherproof Patrol Infrared Alert System Kit
product_meta.description:
The 1byone driveway alarm provides a solution to alert you the moment someone enters your property. It's not only very convenient but also extremely affordable. When movement is detected, the Passive Infrared (PIR) sensor sends a wireless signal to the receiver from up to 100m/328ft away. Adjusting the receiver, you can choose to be alerted by a high or low chime or alarm tone, or instead, with just a silent LED flash. What's more, the receiver can pair with up to 50 sensors, effectively securing a large area. We offer many combinations of sensors and receivers, just choose what best fits your needs. To avoid false alarms: Don't mount the PIR sensor in direct sunlight (as moving heat sources would trigger the PIR) or in a place affected by wind. When installing outside, it's best to mount it in a shady, protected place with minimal changing temperatures. Also, avoiding mounting on UPVC or metal doorframe surfaces which may reduce the transmission range. Specifications: Power Supply (Receiver): DC 6 V or 1.5 V C Battery x 3 (not included) Power Supply (PIR Transmitter): DC 4.5 V (1.5 V AAA Battery x 3 )(not included) Motion detecting range: 5 - 8 m/16-26ft Operating range: 100m/328ft
Ring Volume: ≥100dB ( within 0.5 m/1.6ft) Box Contents: 2 x PIR Transmitters 1 x Receiver 1 x Instruction Manual 4 x Wall Plugs 4 x Screws Here at 1byone, we stand by our products 100% with a 24-month warranty. A happy purchasing experience is our #1 priority and we will happily send a product replacement if any issues arise.
feature_bullets: Reliable Range - Communication range of up to 100m/328ft (the distance from the sensors to the receiver/alarm/chime) and detection range of the infrared sensor of approximately 5-8m/16-26ft to keep you informed and safe.
User-Friendly - The alarm in the receiver has a ring volume up to 100dB, 3 mode choices (Sound/LED Flash/Sound and LED Flash) and 3 alert choices (High Volume Chime/Low Volume Chime/Alarm)

Dependable Technology - Our sensor uses a state-of-the-art passive-infrared (PIR) to detect any movement within the detection zone. Perfect for long or hidden driveways to allow you just a little extra warning before guests (or intruders) arrive.
Expandable - If you have more than one driveway or area you would like to monitor, you can expand this system with multiple sensors and receivers
Power Supply - Both 3 x 1.5V type C batteries and the AC power adapter (not included) can be used for the receiver, but don't use them simultaneously in case the host would be burned
